name: A. Peculiar apple-tree
statement:
In Arcady’s garden there grows a peculiar apple-tree that fruits one
time per year. Its peculiarity can be explained in following way: there
are inflorescences, numbered from to . Inflorescence number is situated
near base of tree and any other inflorescence with number () is situated
at the top of branch, which bottom is -th inflorescence and .Once tree
starts fruiting, there appears exactly one apple in each inflorescence.
The same moment as apples appear, they start to roll down along branches
to the very base of tree. Each second all apples, except ones in first
inflorescence simultaneously roll down one branch closer to tree base,
e.g. apple in -th inflorescence gets to -th inflorescence. Apples that
end up in first inflorescence are gathered by Arcady in exactly the same
moment. Second peculiarity of this tree is that once two apples are in
same inflorescence they . This happens with each pair of apples, e.g. if
there are apples in same inflorescence in same time, only one will not
be annihilated and if there are apples, all apples will be annihilated.
Thus, there can be no more than one apple in each inflorescence in each
moment of time.Help Arcady with counting number of apples he will be
able to collect from first inflorescence during one harvest.
